instruction: Can you provide an update on how your team is addressing the "tough legacy" exposures in the LIBOR transition?
output: As we discussed in our previous blog post on this topic, about one-third of total current LIBOR exposures will mature after the announced timetable for LIBOR cessation, including most of the securitized-product segments. Our team is currently working on developing alternative reference rates and working with clients to transition away from LIBOR. However, we recognize that these "tough legacy" exposures remain a difficult challenge of the LIBOR transition, and we are exploring all available options to address them.
